root: ^The balcony surveys well above the street. The street is empty and quiet. Almos is quiet. He sits across from you now. He usually isn’t quiet on Saturdays. Perhaps you’ve gotten it all wrong. It may be Sunday now that you think about it. The days don’t seem to matter anymore, at least to you, anyway. The radio was playing gurbled nonsense so you just shut it off. The damn thing must have been broken.
^You have a cigarette in hand. Smoke leaves your lips. Almos' face is briefly obstructed from your sight. You're worried he has just disappeared.

b: ^He doesn’t acknowledge you calling his name. You couldn’t help but feel he was gone in that moment. You remind yourself that the smoke just had to clear a little. Everything is fine. You can see Almos now. Almos is looking out from the balcony down to the street.

TB1: ^Almos also has a cigarette in his hand. You remember that two days ago, you poked holes through all of his cigarettes so he wouldn’t be able to smoke them. You’re not sure how either of you is smoking. The cigarettes should have been duds. You ignore the thought for now.

^The balcony is small. You and Almos are sitting upon an aluminum patio set. Just two chairs and a small circular table between you. Three months ago, you both barely sat here. It has become something of a ritual for you both to sit here and watch the sunset.
^The aluminum of the table seems to be rusting. You don’t blame the furniture for rusting. Neither you nor Almos took any particular measures to care for it.

s: ^_Cheap or not, though, you'd wished the patio set had held up much better._

b: ^You’re becoming angry, but you find it challenging to continue to be upset at metal with much more ferocity than a measly lighter flame. It’s probably inanimate, but in the slight chance it does hold sentience, the patio set itself may have known it would rust. Hence, this slight chance of being sentient justifies the small amount of anger you harbour against this patio set.

s: ^_Pull out your phone from your pocket and search for the answer._

b: ^Almos seems captivated in his thoughts. You shouldn’t bother him when you can just look up the answer. You just like hearing his voice, you guess. You concede to your thoughts and pull out your phone.
^No. Aluminum doesn’t rust, apparently. It corrodes. Huh. Interesting, you suppose. You leave the phone out on the table.

TB3: ^You try getting Almos’ attention again by touching his hand, but he stays fixated on the street below. He gets enraptured like this sometimes. Perhaps he’s daydreaming. Maybe he isn’t even really here. His body is before you, but his mind is on another planet, for all you know. You sit in silence for a bit longer.
Daydream: ^Your mind starts to wander.  The furniture looks like it would belong to a cafe in the middle of a garden. Oh, you can see it now. You and Almos are at a lovely coffee shop, which also happens to be in a garden. You’re sitting at a table just like this one. You’re on a small bridge, just above a nice running stream of water, which also happens to be where a coffee shop has put some seating–in the middle of a garden, that is. You think that would be nice. Almos doesn’t like coffee, though. You suppose he liked feeling tired. You think he’d like it just as much as cigarettes.

^You wonder if the garden would have nice flowers. Although you hope there wouldn’t be any flowers close to where you and Almos would be sitting. You get scared of bees, among other things. Speaking of gardens, you’ve never asked Almos what his favorite flowers are. You think he likes carnations. Maybe you should ask him.
Daydream1: ^The street is still holding his gaze. His side profile is the only thing greeting you. He looks frozen. His forearm is like a pillar managing the integrity of his skull. His cheek and chin rest nicely in his hand, serving nicely as a capital. You don’t know if you’re bothered by the fact that he’s not looking at you. His eyes look sullen and droopy. You think he may be tired. He’s always tired, though. You’ve already forgotten what you were going to ask him. An uncomfortable amount of time seems to have passed, marked by his pupils slowly orbiting over to you.
^“What is your favorite flower?” you finally blurt as if your heart had jump-started your lungs.

^He still doesn’t respond. His other hand is still occupied, placing a cigarette in his mouth. You feel like you’ve tried forever to get Almos to stop smoking, but he kind of ropes you in as well. You don’t reckon you have much of a head over your shoulders.

^You bought him gum a while back as a substitute, but you think he likes both gum and cigarettes now. He alternates. You’ve tried hiding his cigarettes, but Almos is really smart. He can always find where you’ve hidden them. Sometimes you’ve thought yourself as doing an incredible job. You were positive he wouldn’t find them this most recent time you’ve hidden them, until of course the moment he actually did. Honestly, if you’d swallowed them, you’re sure he’d still find it–intact at that rate.
^Smoke shrouds Almos once again. For those few seconds, you feel like he’s vanished. He returns to me with the cigarette in his mouth again. He inhales and sighs cotton wisps.

^You poked holes through all of his cigarettes two days ago. You just realized. How are you both smoking, you think to yourself? Did you miss a pack or something? The cigarettes you’re holding are intact. There aren’t any holes to prevent them from being smoked. How does he still have one, let alone you? You feel yourself becoming a very potent mixture of anger and sadness. You feel like purple. You feel like if lavender didn’t have a smell.

s: ^"Almos, I feel like I've told you a million times to stop smoking. Isn't this strange? I'm not sure how this keeps happening."
^"How do you even afford new cigarettes? I thought we blew through our allowance already?"

TB5: ^“Orchids.” He interjects quietly while slowly turning towards me. His face grew heavy with shame as he dropped his gaze.

s: ^"What the hell are you talking about?"
^"Stop trying to distract me! Just answer the question Almos!"

TB6: ^The sternness in your voice maintained vigor as the words rose from your lungs. The speech engulfed your throat as quickly as your emotions had swelled. You feel like you are suffocating. Why were you so easily provoked at nothing? You hope you didn’t make Almos feel sad. You feel the need to say something, but you're all choked up with yourself.
^Almos relinquishes his cigarette during your half-ass apology in the ashtray between you two.
^You try grabbing his hand to comfort him, but he quickly retracted it to his lap. Soon after, he resigned, staring back at the empty street.

s: ^_Look out into the street with Almos_

TB7: ^The sun slowly began to set. Almos slowly began to resign from guarding both the sky and the street. You stare on, though. Something starts to captivate your attention. Were these the same forces acting upon Almos? He seemed so different today. Inexplicable compelled to the horizon.
^The moon shimmered more dramatically as you fixed your eyes on the sky. Light waves wafted through the skies. They called to you—irresistible and sweet. You felt compelled to melt away with the sky.
^Almos’ attention is now entirely on you. It seems your and Almos’ demeanor have completely switched.

^The sun has completely vanished from the sky. Almos felt a new sensation become of him. He felt ethereal. He felt happy. Of course, the tarry skies did not influence the both of you in the same manner. Almos saw change. Reciprocally, you saw an end.
TB8: ^You got out of your seat to lean against the banister. The balcony was high above the charcoal-black ground. The white stripes of the road reminded you of stars. You maneuvered yourself over the banister. There was just enough space on the other end to hold your heels. Your eyes glisten with the moon’s image, filling your body with envy. You wish you could shimmer in Almos’ mind the very same way. With defeat in your heart, you lull and drift off into the moon’s ocean of light. Almos’ eyes calmly chase you seven stories down into the street.
EndOfAnEnd: ^Jupiter is an empty street. / Jupiter is  relentless grief. / Jupiter is the tabacco between your teeth.
JMP1: ^“Almos,” you’re not even sure you consciously expelled his name from your mouth. Can aluminum rust?”
^You always seem to just say his name when you have a question. You think Almos is really smart. He knows a lot of things.
Rabbit: ^You don’t know how long you’ve been sleeping, but you wake up with your face in some concrete. You’re on an empty street. You manage the strength to lift yourself onto your knees.

^Your vision is a little blurry, but your body is seemingly intact. You look behind you in search of the apartment from which you’ve thrown yourself. There’s no such place behind you. You feel like you’re nowhere.

^The world echoes blue and indigo all around you as if the colors were wafting in the air. You inhale, and the world around you melts into your lungs. There's a horrible beeping permeating all around you.
^You slowly turn round again, only to be met with a slender figure placing their face uncomfortably close to yours.
^They’re crouched on the floor before you. They sport a suit and are humanoid in figure. They're covering their face with a rabbit mask.
RabbitBrain: ^"Who are you?" you ask, uncertainly. The figure looks at you with curiosity while lifting itself to a half squat.
RabbitBrain1: ^“Oh. I’m Aiolos.” You’re not sure whether to feel scared or not. The Rabbit nods, gets up, and starts walking away from you. You feel compelled to follow Rabbit.
DHR: ^You approach Rabbit, but as soon as  you start following, they turn around and shake their head disapprovingly. You feel an overwhelming urge to run away from Rabbit.
FollowRabbit: ^You cautiously follow Rabbit. Their footsteps sugar through the blue and indigo mist surrounding you. His silhouette promenades at the edge of your vision.
^You follow them for a while. Their footsteps ramp, faster and faster. To keep them in vision, you’re brought to a jog, and then burst into full-on sprinting.

b: ^You lose Rabbit in the mist, you're utterly alone and swallowed in fog. You begin to walk aimlessly and stumble upon a figure in the distance. You approach thinking it's Rabbit, but you're greeted with a mechanical figure. They are faceless, and the metal rods and cogs that compose their body turn to you. You feel the figure approach you with malicious content. You feel the need to protect yourself.
^The figure clanks towards you. Prepare for combat.

^You lose Rabbit in the mist, you're utterly alone and swallowed in fog. You begin to walk aimlessly and stumble upon a figure in the distance. You approach thinking it's Rabbit, but you're greeted with a balloon animal. You feel the most viscious of auras radiating off of it. It's most definetely dangerous. You tense yourself, and prepare to eliminate the balloon animal.
^The ballon animals waddles towards you, ready for a fight. Prepare to protect yourself.

^The construct's gears sputter and grind to a halt.

^Its final twitch echoes in the silence. You're still breathing, but barely.
^The balloon pops and deflates. The final bits of air that encompassed its being whir into the wash of colors that encompass this world.

FollowRabbit2: ^You're not sure what's become of you or how you've just performed such feats. It felt as though something within you has awakened. You dread no longer on the topic, and continue your search to find Rabbit.

^You're seemingly endless wander is interupted once more by another silloutte. When you approach, you realize it's Rabbit again. The figure stands next to a cubicle object sprouting from the floor. On further inspection, you realize it's a phone box.
^"Call," beckons Rabbit. You only know your own number.

b: ^You would think it would be pointess to call yourself, but you realize you don't have your phone in your pocket. You remember you left it out on the table to see whether aluminum could rust.

^You would think it would be pointless to call yourself, but you realize you don't have your phone in your pocket. You thought for sure it was in your pocket from when you jumped off the balcony, but when you go to feel for ii, it isn't there at all.

R1: ^You call your own number, and the phone rings.

b: ^Someone picks up on the other end. You hear some shuffling before a voice indistinguishable from your own greets you with a "Hello? Who is this?"
^Rabbit looks upon you; its body language is heavy with grief.
^"This is Aiolos... who are you?" you ask.
^"I'm Aiolos too," the voice responds. They sound hollow, "you sound exactly like me."
^I think we're one and the same," you reply. "Are you on the balcony right now?"

^A weary "Yes...?" crinkles across the line. You look To Rabbit for even the slightest bit of clarification. It continues to be mute. Its eyes pierce through yours. You feel as though it is artificially stringing  fish hooks through your eyes and poking and pulling at your throat. You feel compelled to say just one thing.

^Rabbit begins ringing. There's a glowing square in its pocket. Rabbit picks up your call. Its eyes pierce through yours. You feel as though it is artificially stringing  fish hooks through your eyes and poking and pulling at your throat. You feel compelled to say just one thing.
^Rabbit approaches you, and in your panic, you collapse  to the floor and blackout. Rabbit kills you, and you become nothing at all.

BornBefore: ^Jupiter is prolific. / Jupiter is demanding. / Jupiter is the Absolute Authority. / You are now playing as Almos.
BornOnceAgain: ^You feel your vision go hazy for a moment, but you deem it a passing moment of vertigo. What were you about to say again? Oh, yes, you remember now.

^Your thoughts are interrupted by your phone ringing in your pocket. You pick up the phone. "Hello? Who is this?" You hear nobody on the other end. Wrong number, you suppose. Since your phone is out anyway, you might as well search if aluminum can rust.
^No. Aluminum doesn't rust, apparently. It corrodes. Huh. Interesting, you suppose. You leave the phone out on the table.

^You try getting Almos' attention again by touching his hand, but he stays fixated on the street below. He gets  enraptured like this sometimes. Perhaps he's daydreaming. Maybe he isn't even really there. His body is before you, but his mind is on another planet, for all you know. You sit in silence for a bit longer.
RotAway: ^You wander aimless through this picturesque orchid-hued world. You check behind yourself occasionally, and Rabbit is nowhere to be seen. You suppose he didn't care much to follow you, only lead.

^A blue and indigo mist continues to swirl around your legs as you walk though each empty street after the next. You finally stumble upon a park, within it stands firm a children's slide. A peculiar figure could be seen sliding down it, and promptly climbing the ladder attached once again over and over again. You approach slowly, and the figure catches you approaching. He leaves the slide and walk up to you.

b:
^"Hellooo again," he bellows.

^"Again?" you prompt.

^"Well, this version of you won't remember me, haha. But rest assured we have met before. There are a million spindles of you about, and I'm sure to meet a million more."

^He grabs hold of your arm and pulls you close to him. With the other hand he clamps beneath your chin and examines your face.
^"Hellooo," he bellows. "Look at what we have here!" He grabs hold of your arm and pulls you close to him. With the other hand he clamps beneath your chin and examines your face.

s: ^"Mind getting your hands off of me?"

g-0: ^He retracts a little and just smiles. "Hahaha, aren't you a sexy one. You're diseased, aren't you? You look sickly and beautiful and empty." His face grows wicked and stupid. "Trouble in paradise?" he gurgles out sarcastically. "Jumping off a balcony for a man, now? How repulsing."

s: ^"It wasn't like that, you know. Something called to me."

g-1: ^"Ah, yes, of course," he says while pacing about. He circles and examines you now like a shark teasing its prey. He's dressed in gray cloths as if someone wrapped a feathery tapestry around him. The clothes carry the occasionally smear of green hues.

b:
^"Also, who are you calling diseased?" you spout. You're the one that looks like a damn pigeon."

^"Perhaps I was in another life, who knows." he responds. "I certainly dress the part, don't I? Anyhow..."

g-1: ^He halts in front of you once more, "That would be Jupiter that was calling to you. It was lovely, wasn't it? It takes many shapes and forms. Jupiter is multitude, NO, an AMALGAMATION of inexplicable feeling. 'THE PINACLE OF EXISTENCE' some might be bold enough to say." He pauses briefly to clear his throat, "It's also a very real place."
g-2: ^"Of course not," he responds dully. "We're in a sort of in-between world. A proxy, if you will. Your signal to Jupiter was interrupted by something. This place is just as artificial as the reality you once stood in before."
g-3: ^"Well, that little boyfriend of yours did," he says cheerily. "I forgot to mention though, I'm Boris."
^"Well you're awfully quiet now. It's nice to meet you." He strikes his hand out and you reach to shake it.
^You gaze at his hand, but don't go to shake  it. You return your focus to his face.
g-4: ^"Well, according to the script, I'm here to keep you on track when you make stupid decisions. Rabbit is one of Almos' creations."
^You interject, "Didn't you just insult me earlier for jumping off the balcony? Why would Almos create you to say that?"

^"Perhaps he thinks you're predicatable, or just straight pathetic. Who knows, I'm no prophet! Haha! I'm just following the script. Anyway, I'm glad you're here now. Almos wants you to enter some building over here."
^<i>Boris promenades before you leading the path. Before long, you stumble upon what looks like government facility. You feel compelled to voice this to Boris.<i>
^"Hey, isn't this a government building?" you question.

^Boris reels and is taken aback, "How would you know what a government building looks like? Did... someone tell you that this is a government building? You're a spooky one, you know that? Anyway here it is. Almos awaits you within."
^Boris reaches into his pocket and pulls out a keycard, opens the door, and beckons you through.

RunAway: ^You wander aimless through this picturesque orchid-hued world. You check behind yourself occasionally, and Rabbit is nowhere to be seen. You suppose he didn't care much to follow you, only lead.

^A blue and indigo mist continues to swirl around your legs as you walk though each empty street after the next. You finally stumble upon a park, within it stands firm a children's slide. A peculiar figure could be seen sliding down it, and promptly climbing the ladder attached once again over and over again. You approach slowly, and the figure catches you approaching. He leaves the slide and walk up to you.
^"Hellooo," he bellows. "Look at what we have here!" He grabs hold of your arm and pulls you close to him. With the other hand he clamps beneath your chin and examines your face.

s: ^"Mind getting your hands off of me?"

g-0: ^He retracts a little and just smiles. "Hahaha, aren't you a sexy one. You're diseased, aren't you? You look sickly and beautiful and empty." His face grows wicked and stupid. "Trouble in paradise?" he gurgles out sarcastically. "Jumping off a balcony for a man, now? How repulsing."

s: ^"It wasn't like that, you know. Something called to me."

g-1: ^"Ah, yes, of course," he says while pacing about. He circles and examines you now like a shark teasing its prey. He's dressed in gray cloths as if someone wrapped a feathery tapestry around him. The clothes carry the occasionally smear of green hues.

^He halts in front of you once more, "That would be Jupiter that was calling to you. It was lovely, wasn't it? It takes many shapes and forms. Jupiter is multitude, NO, an AMALGAMATION of inexplicable feeling. 'THE PINACLE OF EXISTENCE' some might be bold enough to say." He pauses briefly to clear his throat, "It's also a very real place."
g-2: ^"Of course not," he responds dully. "We're in a sort of in-between world. A proxy, if you will. Your signal to Jupiter was interrupted by something. This place is just as artificial as the reality you once stood in before."
g-3: ^"Well, that little boyfriend of yours did," he says cheerily. "I forgot to mention though, I'm Boris."
^"Well you're awfully quiet now. It's nice to meet you." He strikes his hand out and you reach to shake it.
^You gaze at his hand, but don't go to shake  it. You return your focus to his face.
g-4: ^"Well, according to the script, I'm here to keep you on track when you make stupid decisions. Rabbit is one of Almos' creations."
^You interject, "Didn't you just insult me earlier for jumping off the balcony? Why would Almos create you to say that?"
^"Perhaps he thinks you're predicatable, or just straight pathetic. Who knows, I'm no prophet! Haha! I'm just following the script.

^Boris is now looking off in the distance, "You hear that beeping right? It's best you follow it. It's getting kind of annoying now, ain't it? Also, isn't this your lucky day, I see Rabbit right over there in the distance, I think he still wants you to follow him."

TheGarden: ^<i>You were offered work finally and haven’t had the heart to tell Aiolos yet. You accepted the offer without him knowing. You thought he would be hurt by that. But, at the same time, you had no desire to unpack all that was to come if you had told Aiolos.

^To spare yourself from him, you kept quiet, but that doesn’t mean you’ve spared yourself from the guilt. Aiolos can be very dramatic at times, and you’ve never lied to Aiolos before. But, being afforded a night shift at this new job–after some slight negotiation with the recruiters–has made the lying a little easier.
^Is it really lying if you haven’t said anything?

^Regardless, you’ve left for work every night–or rather, early morning–on weekdays for a little over two weeks now. And, by leaving for work, you really mean sneaking out at night to avoid waking up Aiolos.

^The work isn’t particularly exciting. You’re usually assigned small coding tasks, most of which require you to clean up some already present scripts, or you trying your hand at making them more efficient.
^From twelve to six in the morning, you’re posted up in one of the government’s proxy facilities close to your apartment.

^To manage population distributions, citizens were assigned keycards, and all exits to residences were equipped with scanners. Leaving one’s home requires both a key card and a retinal scan, at which point a curfew reminder will be sent to your phone.

^Citizens are required to complete a second scan when they return to their residence. Failure to do so prior to the curfew could result in serious consequences–so you were informed that is. Neither Aiolos nor you had any intention of finding out.

^Additionally, you could only scan your keycard to leave your home during permitted time slots on par with your citizen rank. At all other points in time, exits were permanently locked. Even windows, despite being open, were fitted with detection systems to alert law enforcement to suspicious activity.<i>
TheGardenP2: ^<i>You are both brought food and toiletries at the start of each week. It usually comfortably lasts us until the next drop-off. Essentials are always provided, but since neither Aiolos nor you were employed until recently, you both would just passively gain a newly established currency as an allowance. Varying items outside of the essentials could be ordered with the new coin.

^The selection isn’t all too exciting unfortunately. There’s some stuff like board games, playing cards, and video games for entertainment purposes, but Aiolos loved to rave of how appreciative he was of the provided selection of different bouquets of flowers.

^You suppose people wanted to make their interior a little bright and flashy, but it never was of much importance to you. Aiolos loves sprucing up the apartment though, ever since the government had mandated the tight restrictions around leaving the unit.
^One thing you did love, though, was the selection of varied pastries and higher-end delicacies. Your apartment was subsequently always filled with flowers and pastry.
^That’s pretty much all you and Aiolos spent the currency on.

^Despite the added selection being behind a paywall, you’ve never had complaints about the essential food and ingredients provided to you both. You’re exceptional at cooking, and you extend that service to Aiolos as well.

^C-class citizens, like Aiolos, could only open the door in times of Essential Collections. However, because citizens are meant only to briefly open their door to collect items, a five minute curfew timer was placed.

^Aiolos somehow gets painfully close to missing the deadline, however. It’s often a mixture of him brining in the bags one at a time, and him deciding to organize the supplies in your fridge while the door is still open.

^It drive you mad that he won’t just drag the bags inside, close the door, rescan, and deal with organizing after. You feel your throat straining in anger already at the thought of it. You try not to get too worked up.
^Due to your new job, you were afforded B-class citizen status. It’s essentially identical to that of a C-class citizen, with the added authority of leaving for work in your allotted time slot.

^You honestly wish the government gave you a color coded keycard that reflected your rank. The metallic, gray rectangles are a little bland for your taste. Citizen information is already openly available for public lookup.

^Even B-class citizens have their curfew time-window attached to their profile. You think it wouldn’t be much of a security risk. Speaking of which, you really hope that Aiolos doesn’t go stalking your profile.
^You’re afraid of the difficult conversation that would ensue. Sometimes you feel controlled by Aiolos. Perhaps you give him too much jurisdiction over your being.

b: ^You feel yourself awaken from a horrible nightmare. You were just murdered by Aiolos. You lay perfectly still as if still in stasis. You stay there and allow the fright to subside.

T1: ^You prop yourself on your forearms and lift your chest to get a better look at the clock on your nightstand. You blink a couple of times to bring it into focus. It's around twelve o'clock noon. You don't sleep very much nowadays because of your night shift, but it's the only way to pursue this venture without Aiolos knowing. You wonder why he hasn't grown suspicious of the fact that you 'sleep' for an excessive amount of time. Perhaps he thinks you're depressed.

^You try to pretend you're still sleeping to get an extra hour of rest in, but you fear you've already made too much noise ruffling the sheets. Aiolos has a pretty good ear for that, unfortunately. You guess he gets bored waiting for you to wake up.
^"Almos? Are you awake?" His voice is miserable and distant. You feel your heart sink. You didn't  want to ignore him.

s: ^_Get up from the bed and go to Aiolos._

FOF: ^You face plant back into the pillow, and the world around you dims to nothing.

^You awake in your dreams. You’re sitting at a table with Aiolos. You’re at a lovely coffee shop, which also happens to be in a garden. You’re on a small bridge, just above a nice running stream of water, which also happens to be where a coffee shop has put some seating–in the middle of a garden, that is. You feel happy here.
^Aiolos is smiling as well. He feels happy here.

^You don’t like coffee, though. You’re not entirely sure why you’re here, maybe subconsciously your mind wants you to drink some coffee. You are tired all the time. You may like it just as much as cigarettes.
^You wonder if the garden has some of your favorite flowers. You hope there aren’t any flowers close to where you and Aiolos would be sitting. Aiolos is scared of bees, among other things.
^You sit in silence for a while. Aiolos stares intently at you, while your eyes are traced on a field of flowers just in vision from the bridge you sit upon.

g-0: ^You feel enraptured by the field of flowers in the distance. Aiolos doesn’t respond to your “Hm.” You feel tired. Your eyes are sullen and droopy. Finally, Aiolos breaks his silence, “What is your favorite flower?”
^You’ve never really thought of an answer to this question. You sit in thought for a while, just thinking and thinking and thinking. You don't really have a favorite flower.
^You think Aiolos is becoming frustrated with your lack of response. You want to ask Aiolos a question to break the silence.
g-1: ^Aiolos lets in a great sigh, “That’s a great question, honestly. I was hoping you would know the answer to that one.”

^His eyes follow yours to the flower field. “It feels like we’re trapped, honestly, I haven’t been able to put all the pieces together, but nothing feels right. You ignore me a whole lot. What’s up with that?”

s: ^"I've just been caught up in my thoughts a lot."

FOF1: ^“Yeah, I know that,” he responds, “but the old you would never have been this distant. I feel like you’re not even here sometimes, which honestly is kind of true.” He holds his tongue for a while, “I know about your new job, by the way. I think you sometimes take me for a fool. I don’t think I would have been upset. I’m just more upset you didn’t tell me.”

s: ^"I'm sorry, I don't really know what to say."

g-0: ^“You don’t have to say anything at all. I just want to share this moment with you. We won’t have this forever, you know.”

s: ^"Do you want to head to the field of flowers?"

g-1: ^“Sure thing.” Aiolos rises from his seat gracefully and extends his hand out to you. You grab hold of his hand, and he leads you to the middle of the flower field. It feels as though the flower field gets further and furrther the more you pursue it.
^"Do you hear that?" Aiolos says to you. He extends his arm out to you and blocks you from walking any further.
^I think... I think I hear bees.
^You look over to him and his face is flush with panic.
^"Don't worry we can handle it," you announce. You bring focus to your hand and manifest a sword within. You feel in control. You're aware you're in a dream state.
^Aiolos is encouraged by your confidence. He reciprocally manifests a gun in hand.
^Two bees materialize before you. Prepare for combat.

FOF2: ^You look to each other but neither of you speak.
^You both continue your march to the field of flowers.
^You both walk for an un-trivial amount of time before finally stumbling upon a pocket of orchids.

^The orchids are aranged in too perfect of a matter. The pocket is a perfect circle. It's as if the orchids were meant to be a beacon, or rather a target. You internalize these thoughts, but a part of you feels like you're meant to be here in this very moment. This place is calling to you, and you're braced to fall within its influence.
^Aiolos pulls you down to the ground, and you’re both lying in the flowers. The sun above you feels gentle as it pours its warmth upon you. You feel happy being around Aiolos.

^Aiolos lifts himself from his back and collapses upon you, hugging you. You hug him back. Aiolos leans in closer to your ear and whispers to you, “Earlier today, a voice over the phone told me to kill you, Almos.”
^You don’t feel frightened by this sentiment.

s: ^"Are you going to listen to the voice?"

g-0: ^You're voice is calm and collected. You query Aiolos, "Are you going to listen to the voice?"
^“Of course,” he responds. You close your eyes. Everything is going to be okay. You relinquish yourself, and you let Aiolos strangle you to death.

EOTW: ^Jupiter fuels fame. / Jupiter exhausts your brain. / Jupiter is the one and only love you may tame. / You are now playing as Aiolos.
Gun: ^You rise from the bed in a clumsy stir and walk over to the door to greet Aiolos. He usually likes to watch television in the mornings and awaits you on the couch to watch a show or two. This time, however, when you upon the door, you're greeted by Aiolos already approaching you slowly. His hands are behind his back. He seems paranoid.

b: ^You both stand there for an uncomfortable amount of time in a standoff. You look down at your feet. Both of you have become ankle deep in the red liquid. The room is filling with a metallic air. It feels corrosive to breathe in. You hold your breathe. You feel sick, but you return your focus to Aiolos.
^Behind Aiolos you see a glimpse of the living room from around the corner. It seems as there there's a thin layer of red liquid pooling slowly into the hallway.

Gun2: ^"I'm really sorry. Like, really... really..." his voice drones off to a low mumble.

b: ^The room is still slowly filling with the red  liquid. You both are chest deep. Aiolos wades through and approaches you. He just hugs you, and you hug him back.
^You both stay there, planted firmly, until the room is completely flooded.
^You both drown in each other's arms.
^You back up a little into the doorway. "Sorry for what?" you question.

Gun3: ^Aiolos slowly brings his arms from behind his back and places them at eye level. He's got a gun clutched in his hands.
^You have no time to react before the trigger goes off.
ParadiseLost: ^Jupiter is an amzing place, you know! / You'll feel nothing at all! / You'll be everything and nothing at once! / Oh, how freeing Jupiter will be! / A whole new world! / A whole new frontier! / You are now playing as Aiolos.
PL: ^A man is speaking to you. He’s made of machine. His voice holds heart.
^"What does it look like to be free, Aiolos?"
^You know not how to answer. The world around you is a swirling wash of green and brown echoes.
^Without any effort of your own, you begin to speak.
^"It looks like I'm not fucking yearning and plagued by such intense emotions all the time. It's that I don't feel sad all the time. Why can't you understand that?"

^The voice that permeates from where you stand now sounds like he's crying. You look down to examine yourself. Your whole body appears to be made of metal. Your arms, your torso, your legs; you are a walking aluminum skeleton.

^You close your eyes and meditate. You bring focus back to yourself, and when you open your eyes, you remain suspended in a mist of mercury. You are hugging Almos. You try to breathe in. You feel the mist envelope you as it enters your lungs. With every breath a new memory takes over your mind.
^You repeat this until the heavy shroud of rust thins out with each episode you re-live.
^You begin to hear all. See all.
PL2: ^You feel a compelling force surrounding your body.
^You know you should be terrified, but all you can feel is a sense of security.
^"I've finally found you," a voice calls.
^"It was no small effort to carefully pluck you from the expanse."
^"You have been saved. I cherish you, so deeply, Aiolos."
^"What once would have perished to the great expanse not holds home, here."
^"I will breathe life into once more."
^"A human body shall bind you no more to a flicker of existence."
^You feel the force unravel and dissipate from around your body.
^You don't feel enraptured or under siren.
^"Welcome to Jupiter..." you mumble to yourself.
PL3: ^You are now playing as Obsolete Android.
WorldOfRot: ^Your vision is blurry, and your heart is pounding out of your chest.
^You have a knife gripped in your hand. Your eyes begin to focus.
^Almos is bloodied and resting on the bed. He is calm; his body doesn't rise or fall. You’re stricken with grief.
^You walk to the bathroom to clean your face.
^You turn on the sink, and gather water in your cupped hands.
^You bring the water to your face, over and over again.
^You're more so tossing the water upon yourself and hoping it cleans you.
^You're shirt becomes increasingly drenched in water.
^You look up to the mirror to see your reflection, only to be met with Almos' gaze meeting yours. His movements are identical, he blinks and raises his hand when you do.
^You begin to cry, but Almos just stands there looking at you across the glass.
^You reach out to the glass and begin caressing Almos' cheek.

g-0: ^You whisper sweet nothings to your reflection.
^"I'm so sorry... I'm so sorry," you bellow.
^You feel a wash of vertigo come about you.
^You stumble to the balcony for some fresh air.
^You feel sick. Your love is dead.
^The sun shines upon you, its glow warm and inviting. You feel Almos calling to you.
^Your eyes glisten in the sun’s image, filling your body with strength and devotion.
^Although nobody is watching you this time, you fall seven stories down onto the street.

Government: ^Jupiter is joy. / Jupiter is lavender. / Jupiter is love. / You are now playing as Almos.
G1: ^You feel yourself awaken in a stupor of amnesia. You have no idea why you are in an office.
^There's a computer screen before you that's now gone to sleep. You remember that you usually work late at night in a government building.
^You hope you weren't asleep for too long. In your wake, you feel a certain tinge of immateriality to the cubicle you now sit in.
^You're most certainly in your office. You really hope you haven't accidentally slept for too long.
^There are diagrams scattered all over your desk, some of which have frantic and messy edits upon them chalked in with pencil.
^You try to open the drawer underneath your desk but the locks won't budge. You have no idea where the key could be.
^You check the clock. Two hours left to go before you can go home. Your stomach bubbles. You head to the break room for food.
^The office is always empty. You suppose you just have an awkward shift, but it’s of your own accord. The hallways are dimly lit. On the way to the break room you pass several series of closed doors.
^All are locked by keycard. You always assume you don’t have the security privileges to enter them. There’s no real reason either, you just stick to your corner of the office.
^There’s a box of chocolate muffins in the break room. A little note is left in front of the box.
^You don’t really know who Marilyn is though. You put the muffin in the microwave to heat it up and watch intently as it whirs for a minute and fifteen seconds.
^You think about how Aiolos always says to not stand in front of microwaves.
G2: ^As you're sitting and eating the now gooey muffin, you hear a loud thud coming from the hall.
^The noise expands to the door of the room.
^You feel your heart lower and become heavy.
^You don't really want to stop eating the muffin, though, to investigate. The noise seems to cease and you reason that someone else just entered the office to work.
^Minutes later you hear feet shuffling on the other side of the door once more. Someone starts clawing on the door.
^“Um… The door isn’t locked. It’s open?” you mutter with both fear and confusion.
^The clawing turns to banging. The door swells with each strike.
^You feel electrified and numb. You feel like you can't breathe. You want to escape.
^You huddle into the corner with a butter knife from the table.
G3: ^The door breaks open and you nearly faint. Your stomach can’t digest your beating heart and you fall to the floor in terror. Your vision becomes blurry. You can't move your legs.
^You claw your way back to the table to prop yourself on a chair. You get yourself upright and notice the door is in fact open. You don't think anyone enetered the room. The room is dead.
G4: ^"Hellooo!" A peculiar looking fellow peeks his head through the door. "Sorry I thought the door was sort of a pull... thing, not a push..."
^He then bursts through the doorway and rushes to stand before you.
G5: ^"WE NEED TO GET YOU BOTH OUT OF HERE." Boris's stance is now firm.

g-0: ^"Yeah! Both! Aiolos is here too, you just can't see him. I've brought him here as requested.
g-1: ^"Yes Mr. Echo-er. Get your own lines for once. Anyhoo, Of course you have, silly! Don't be stupid now. You've made this all a reality, and now is the time to escape back to Jupiter!
g-2: ^"I'm sooo glade you asked!" Boris now shakes with excitement as if he's been waiting all his life to say the following:

^"Jupiter is multitude, NO, an AMALGAMATION of inexplicable feeling. 'THE PINACLE OF EXISTENCE' some might be bold enough to say." He pauses briefly to clear his throat, "It's also a very real place."
^You stare blankly at Boris in both awe and confusion.
^"Well we aren't going the main way. We are using a sort of back-door per se. If you don't remember, this is your proxy world. Some data may have not been transferred to your current form."

s: ^"How do you know all of this information?"

g-3: ^"Well, you made me. I'm simply a vessel for all the information you had me contain."
^Boris now reaches his arm around himself. He begins hugging himself.

b: ^"I feel so full, yet empty at the same time," Boris wallows. "If only I had that muffin."

g-3: ^You're not sure what to feel at this point. This is all quite bizarre to you. You wait in silence and continue to observe Boris hugging himself to the point where it becomes awkward.

G6: ^Boris snaps out of his trance, "Anyhow, let's head to the control room, I'm meant to give the both of ya'll access so you can return to Jupiter.
^You won't be returning under traditional means, however, you both are prisoners after all. Just make sure you're well prepared for whatever awaits you on the other end."
^You nervously look to Boris as he waddles out of the room. You follow sheepishly unknowing of what is to come.
G7: ^You follow Boris through corridors before he parks himself in front of a locked door. Boris reaches into his pocket and flips through a ring of keys in intense search.

^He finds the right key, unlocks the door and pushes through. You both are met with what seems to be a closet rather than a room. Within this confined space is a couple computer screens followed by a terminal at waist level.

s: ^"You mentioned Aiolos being here as well?"

G8: ^"Yep!" Boris says. "Don't think too hard about that one. He's in another instance of your proxy world."

s: ^"So are you in both instances at the same time?"

g-0: ^"I'm an overseer of  sorts --  a manager, if you will."
^You can't be bothered to quesetion this any further.

s: ^"Fine, let's just get out of here."

G9: ^"I thought you'd never ask!" Boris turns quickly to the terminal and begins furiously smashing the buttons. Suprisingly, it appears he is controlled and mechanical in his movements.

^"Annnddd done!" Boris grabs hold of your hand and places it on a panel of the terminal. He moves his other hand and seemingly grabs the air and additionally places it on the terminal. "I'll see you on the other side, don't miss me for too long."
^With that, your vision washes over, and you're being is succumbed to a red mist.
ET: ^You approach the terminal the terminal cautiously.

b: ^Your memory feels blurred, but you're slowly beggining to remember. This is an Andromeda terminal. It's meant to uphold simulations of grandeur and delusion. You worked on these exact models.
^The thing whirs with seemingly redundant buttons flashing on that back off again. It gets to a point where it's a little dramatic, surely.

ET: ^You notice a single keypad within the center of it.
^"I see you eyeing the terminal," Boris chimes in. "This is how we're going to get you home."

^You're not precisely sure what 'home' truly means. You don't know whether to trust Boris anymore. He doesn't seem to be particularly harmful, however. Well, at least to the extent in which he wouldn't harm himself.

s: ^"You mentioned Aiolos being here as well?"

GSpecial: ^"Hellooo," Boris echoes back. "Before we get down to business, can I have a piece of that muffin."
^Boris is now indiscriminately pointing at the gooey muffin you left on the table in fear.

b:
^"Ah thanks man I was getting kind of hungry."

^He reaches for the muffin and stuffs the whole thing in his mouth. He looks to you now with his mouth full.

^"Sorry I got a little carried away there," he says while crumbs are flying out of his mouth like sparks.

^Your face goes sour with both confusion and the realization that your muffin is now gone. You look longingly at the table and mourn the loss briefly before redirecting your attention back to Boris.

^"Oh..." Boris pouts. "Ok then, I guess."

^He still goes over to pick up the muffin and graceously hands it to you.

^You skeptically take a couple bites out of it, half because you're still hungry, and half because you want to see the dissapointment on Boris' face when he realizes you truly aren't sharing.

^Boris watches intently as you finish the whole muffin right before him. He shakes off the dissapointment and his attention is brought back to you.

WNW: ^You awaken in a cylindrical chamber. On the other side of your glass prison is a room filled with wires and monitors.
^You know not whether you were being experimented on.
^You hold your palms to your face. Just like the dream, you are once more made of metal.
^You are both man and machine. Equivocally, they blur into the same thing.
^You metallic head falls into your metallic hands in frustration. They grind and clink upon each other.
^You feel everything, as if the very metal itself was imbued with nerves.
^You touch the glass that encapsulates you.
^You feel the friction against your fingertips.
^You begin to panic and become slightly claustrophobic.
^The room itself appears to be holding cell. There's a small window on the door into the cell. You see a hallway through the little square of glass.
ObserveHallway: ^You try to calm yourself down before making any rash decisions. As a machine, you know you can't breathe, but you feel as though you could. A breath swells in your throat and stays there with no release or entry.
^You close your eyes, and swallow hard. You're going to break through the glass.
